description: A 10x20mm caseless high-velocity round. Powerful propellant allows the bullet increased velocity and minor penetration capabilities, noticeably improving its efficacy at medium ranges, although it still suffers significantly compared to a rifle bullet. Being caseless rounds, these cannot be disassembled or reloaded.

A 10x20mm caseless armor-piercing round. The bullet tips are made out of high-density material, allowing them to pierce straight through armor, but also reducing the raw stopping power and velocity of the ammunition. Being caseless rounds, these cannot be disassembled or reloaded.
.44 magnum ammunition with 240gr HI bullets. The heavy composite material that makes up the bullet's core causes it to have lesser exit velocity and damage, but dazes the target on impact.

A 10x24mm caseless round. The cartridge consists of a 210 grain steel-jacketed projectile embedded within a rectangular propellant block of Nitramine 50. Being caseless rounds, these cannot be disassembled or reloaded.

A 10x24mm caseless armor piercing round. The cartridge's explosive tip's factory pre-set impact fuse is designed to explode after the round has penetrated armor to inflict maximum damage, and so it will often over-penetrate soft targets without exploding, leaving them relatively unharmed. Being caseless rounds, these cannot be disassembled or reloaded.
